questions.question: What are the 3 most common forms of matter on earth?

choices.answer: Solids, liquids, and gases
Electrons, protons, and neutrons
atoms, molecules, and ions
Breakfasts, Lunches, Suppers

questions.question: What are the particles that make up  all matter?

choices.answer: Solids, liquids, and gases
Electrons, protons, and neutrons
atoms, molecules, and ions
Lunches, Breakfasts, and Suppers

questions.question: What are the 3 states of water?

choices.answer: Solids, liquids, and gases
Electrons, protons, and neutrons
atoms, molecules, and ions
Water, ice, steam

questions.question: What are the 3 measurements that you can use to describe matter?

choices.answer: color, texture, taste
mass, volume, density
length, width, height
solid, liquid, gas

questions.question: What is a solid?

choices.answer: Matter that has a definite shape and volume
Matter with a definite volume but not shape
Matter with no definite shape or volume

questions.question: What is a liquid?

choices.answer: Matter that has a definite shape and volume
Matter with a definite volume but not shape
Matter with no definite shape or volume

questions.question: What is a gas?

choices.answer: Matter that has a definite shape and volume
Matter with a definite volume but not shape
Matter with no definite shape or volume

questions.question: What are the 2 main factors that determine the state of matter?

choices.answer: particle location and particle elevation
particle length and particle mass
Particle motion and particle forces

questions.question: Which state of matter has more kinetic energy?

choices.answer: Solid
Liquid
Gas
Fire

questions.question: Which state of matter has the least kinetic energy?

choices.answer: Solid
Liquid
Gas
Fire

questions.question: How are temperature and particle motion related?

choices.answer: They are not related
When temperature goes up, particle motion goes down
When temperature goes up, particle motion goes up

questions.question: When does a ball you drop have the most potential energy?

choices.answer: a ball does not have potential energy
just before it hits the ground
just before you drop it
about half way down

questions.question: What is the relationship between boiling, vaporization, and evaporation?

choices.answer: They are all the exact same thing
boiling and evaporation are types of vaporization
vaporization and evaporation are types of boiling
boiling and vaporization are types of evaporation

questions.question: What is Melting?

choices.answer: changing from a solid to a liquid
changing from a solid to a gas
changing from a gas to a solid
changing from liquid to a solid

questions.question: What is Freezing?

choices.answer: changing from a solid to a liquid
changing from a solid to a gas
changing from a gas to a solid
changing from liquid to a solid

questions.question: What is Evaporation?

choices.answer: Changing from a gas to a liquid
Changing from a liquid to a gas
changing from a solid to a gas
changing from a gas to a solid

questions.question: What is Condensation?

choices.answer: Changing from a gas to a liquid
Changing from a liquid to a gas
changing from a solid to a gas
changing from a gas to a solid

questions.question: What is Sublimation?

choices.answer: Changing from a gas to a liquid
Changing from a liquid to a gas
changing from a solid to a gas
changing from a gas to a solid

questions.question: What is Deposition?

choices.answer: Changing from a gas to a liquid
Changing from a liquid to a gas
changing from a solid to a gas
changing from a gas to a solid

questions.question: Put the following in order of occurrence when thermal energy is being added:

choices.answer: Boiling, Gas, Liquid, Melting, Solid
Liquid, Boiling, Solid, Melting, gas
Solid, Melting, Liquid, Boiling, Gas
Gas, Boiling, Liquid, Solid, Melting

questions.question: What is the Law of Conservation of Mass and Energy?

choices.answer: Mass and energy are created during reactions
Mass and energy are destroyed during reactions
Mass is created and energy destroyed during reactions
Neither mass or energy are created or destroyed

questions.question: What are the 2 most important statements of the Kinetic molecular theory?

choices.answer: Particles collide with each other and their containers and lose energy.
Particles collide with each other and their containers and don’t lose energ
They are all important

questions.question: What is it that causes pressure?

choices.answer: The spaces between the particles of the gas
It just comes naturally when a substance is a gas
Particles hitting each other and their containers
What type of particles it is made of

questions.question: What is it that makes gases compressible?

choices.answer: The spaces between the particles of the gas
It just comes naturally when a substance is a gas
Particles hitting each other and their containers
What type of particles it is made of

questions.question: What is an example of a change in pressure causing a change in volume which can be painful for us?

choices.answer: Swimmers ear
Pressure in ears when going up or down in elevation
Having to go to the bathroom really bad
climbing stairs

questions.question: What is “absolute zero? (the temperature)

choices.answer: 0 degrees C
0 degrees F
-273 degrees C
-273 degrees F

questions.question: What happens at absolute zero?

choices.answer: Everything dies!
All motion of particle stops
All particles speed up their motion
Nothing happens
